title: 105_s1418
content: The Act may be cited as the "Methane Hydrate Research and Development Act of 1998". Definitions are provided in the Act. The Act defines key terms such as contract, cooperative agreement, grant, methane hydrate, Secretary, and Secretary of Defense. The Act defines key terms such as contract, cooperative agreement, grant, methane hydrate, Secretary, and Secretary of Defense, Secretary of the Interior, and Director of the National Science Foundation. The Act defines key terms related to methane hydrate research and development program. The Act establishes a methane hydrate research and development program, with designated individuals meeting regularly to review progress and make recommendations. The Secretary may award grants, contracts, or cooperative agreements for assistance and coordination. The Act establishes a methane hydrate research and development program, with grants or contracts awarded to universities and industrial enterprises for research on methane hydrate as an energy source, technology development, transport and storage safety, environmental impact assessment, and education and training. The Act establishes a methane hydrate research and development program to address environmental impacts, develop technologies for drilling through methane hydrates, and consult with experts from industry, academia, and federal agencies. The Secretary may establish an advisory panel to advise on potential applications and assist in developing recommendations. Administrative expenses are limited to 5 percent of the amount available for the program. The Secretary is responsible for developing partnerships to research methane hydrate resources, creating programs for long-term interest in methane hydrate as an energy source, and ensuring data and information are developed effectively. No funds can be used for construction projects under this section. The Secretary must ensure data accessibility, promote cooperation among agencies for methane hydrate technology, and report annually to Congress on achievements under this Act. SEC. 4. AMENDMENT TO THE MINING AND MINERALS POLICY ACT OF 1970. Section 201 of the Mining and Minerals Policy Act of 1970 is amended to include a definition of methane hydrate as a methane clathrate that is stable and occurs naturally in deep-ocean and permafrost areas. Additionally, authorization of appropriations is provided. Authorization of appropriations is provided for carrying out this Act.
